instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 5 sec and then turns off
threads.message:
Cpu voltage is present while the fans are spinning. 
i have already reflasshed the efi. still same. 
the board has neither liquid nor corrosion on it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 5 sec and then turns off
threads.message:
Did you try the board alone on the desk?
Also try starting in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 5 sec and then turns off
threads.message:
The board alone does the same.
In Smc Bypass mode also

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 5 sec and then turns off
threads.message:
What said the client about the failure?
You coukd have damaged CPU by FDMF6808 chips.

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 5 sec and then turns off
threads.message:
the client told us that it just turned off suddenly and then never turned on again.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is high wile its spinnng the fans, and low while the fans are not turning

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 5 sec and then turns off
threads.message: Try known good BIOS, just in case...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 5 sec and then turns off
threads.message: is there no other possible solution, that i could try

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins for 5 sec and then turns off
threads.message: Possibly problem caused by FDMF6808N chips, classic for this board.
